README.md.name: README.md

metadata.firstNLines:
This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/cli/create-next-app).

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/fonts) to automatically optimize and load [Geist](https://vercel.com/font), a new font family for Vercel.

## Learn More

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!

README.md.upperLevelSummary: Documentation file providing project overview and development setup instructions for this Next.js application.

app/globals.css.name: globals.css
app/globals.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines global CSS variables and base reset styles applied across the application via the root layout.

app/layout.tsx.name: layout.tsx
app/layout.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This root layout component defines the application's global metadata, fonts, and styles for all pages.

app/page.module.css.name: page.module.css
app/page.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines layout and typography styles for the main application page as an isolated CSS module.

app/page.tsx.name: page.tsx
app/page.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Serves as the main entry point for the home route by rendering a centered layout that integrates the Calculator and Visualizer components.

components/Button.module.css.name: Button.module.css
components/Button.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Provides layout and appearance styles for the Button component used in components/Button.tsx.

components/Button.tsx.name: Button.tsx
components/Button.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Exports a styled calculator button component with multiple visual variants for use within ButtonGrid.tsx.

components/ButtonGrid.module.css.name: ButtonGrid.module.css
components/ButtonGrid.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Provides responsive four-column grid styles used by the ButtonGrid component to manage button layout and spacing.

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.name: ButtonGrid.tsx

metadata.firstNLines:
import Button from "./Button";
import styles from "./ButtonGrid.module.css";

interface ButtonGridProps {
    onButtonClick: (value: string) => void;
}

/**
 * Calculator button grid component
 * Arranges buttons in a 4x5 grid layout
 */
export default function ButtonGrid({ onButtonClick }: ButtonGridProps) {
    const buttons = [
        { value: "C", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "±", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "%", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "÷", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "7", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "8", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "9", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "×", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "4", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "5", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "6", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "-", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "1", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "2", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "3", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "+", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "0", variant: "number" as const, wide: true },

components/ButtonGrid.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Arranges Button components into a 4x5 grid layout for the Calculator component using local styles and a click event handler.

components/Calculator.module.css.name: Calculator.module.css
components/Calculator.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Provides the visual styling and responsive layout definitions for the Calculator component.

components/Calculator.tsx.name: Calculator.tsx
components/Calculator.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This main calculator component manages state and logic by orchestrating the Display and ButtonGrid subcomponents through the core calculator library.

components/Display.module.css.name: Display.module.css
components/Display.module.css.upperLevelSummary: Defines CSS module styles for the layout and appearance of the Display component used in components/Display.tsx.

components/Display.tsx.name: Display.tsx
components/Display.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Renders the calculator's current value and calculation history for the Calculator component using styles from Display.module.css.

eslint.config.mjs.name: eslint.config.mjs
eslint.config.mjs.upperLevelSummary: Configures project-wide linting by extending Next.js and TypeScript presets with custom global file exclusions.
